climbs.name: Super Spy
climbs.fa: TR, John Bachar 1980  FL, Jonny Woodward

content.description: This the left leaning part of the V crack located on  Pillar 1.
content.protection: Thin to 2 inches plus a bolt for the bottom face section

climbs.name: Secret Agent Man
climbs.fa: TR, John Bachar 1980  FL, Hidetaka Suzuki

content.description: This is the right leaning crack of the prominent V cracks.

Short right-slanting crack on Pillar 1 to the right of Secret Agent Man.  Awkward.  Something to do while waiting for better stuff nearby.  Also, there's an inward pointing thin flake deep inside the crack near the top that could trap and get the rope stuck.  Able to free with a trekking pole fetched from the car.  Bonus problem solving to add to life skills.
content.protection: Light rack of cams to 3", gear anchor.
content.location: Walk off by scrambling to backside gap, stemming outward, and transferring onto lower part of shoulder, to touch down out near the end.

climbs.name: Acid Rock
climbs.fa: Mike Lechlinski, Gib Lewis, Charles Cole, Marius Morsted, Dean Fidelman, 11/1979.

content.description: Start up a steep hand crack on the side of the tall narrow pillar from inside the corridor.  Get onto a ledge, then up the main pillar face past horizontals.  3 bolts, a fixed pin, and supplemental cams protect a thin crease and the crux finish.  3-bolt anchor with hangers near the lip but no rap hardware.  Rap down the gap on NW side via bolted rap chains atop West Face Route, between Pillars 2 and 3, to touch down on the parking lot side.  Step way back to pull the rope to clear the big chock boulders.
content.protection: 3 bolts, 1 fixed pin, single cams with additional second BD Blue #3, triple anchor bolts equipped with hangers only.
content.location: Located on the south side of Pillar 2, the middle Pillar of Pain, on the farside away from parking lot.  The three adjacent pillars are between Turtle Rock and the parking lot.  Approach the backside of these pillars through the gaps or around the sides
